semantic_identifier: 132: feat: Scheduled CRM refresh: dedupe records via canonical ID mapping (Salesforce/HubSpot)

sections.text:
## Description

Adds deterministic deduplication on top of the scheduled read-only Salesforce/HubSpot refresh to prevent duplicate Accounts/Contacts/Opportunities across runs.

Implementation:
- Introduces a canonical mapping table keyed by (workspace_id, crm_provider, crm_object_type, crm_record_id) -> internal_entity_id, with uniqueness enforced at the DB level.
- Adds a merge layer in the refresh pipeline that resolves multiple candidates for the same internal entity using provider-specific precedence + field-level conflict rules for in-scope fields (prefers non-null, newest updated_at when both present, preserves existing when source is missing).
- Handles deletes and ID changes safely:
  - If a CRM record is deleted/404, marks mapping as inactive and stops updating the internal entity from that record.
  - If a record ID changes (detected via provider-specific stable keys/redirects when available), rewrites the mapping to the new ID while keeping the same internal_entity_id.
- Ensures idempotency: reruns of the same snapshot will not create new internal entities or flip mappings.

Observability:
- Emits per-run metrics (created_mappings, reused_mappings, merges_applied, conflicts_resolved, orphaned_mappings, deletions_seen) and structured logs with workspace/provider/object identifiers for audit/debug.

User impact:
- Sales_Accelerator will see a single stable internal entity per CRM record across refresh runs, improving forecasting and next-best-action consistency. No config changes required.

## How Has This Been Tested?
